result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession of a Firearm by a Felon
Body Armor - Violent Felon (Out of State)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles D. Marshall

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing - Unable to Forward per USPS
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward

(3:16 PM cases 22CF1149, 22CF1150 called.) Defendant Charles D. Marshall in court. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Charles D. Marshall. Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State advises is ready to proceed.
Attorney Patek advises is not comfortable proceeding as the defendant informed him he'd like to obtain private counsel.
Attorney Patek feels it is not appropriate to represent the defendant for a Preliminary Hearing knowing the defendant requests private counsel.
State requests to proceed as the defendant has not waived time limits and the defendant can still retain new counsel in the future.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing in cases 22CF1149, 22CF1150.
Court advises will adjourn and allow the defendant time to obtain new counsel.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
State advises if the defendant appears at next hearing without an attorney, the State will request the Court find the defendant has waived his right to an attorney.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No contact with co-defendants K.B., S.G.; J.B. or J.B.'s residence, M.W. or M.W.'s residence.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
No use or possession of weapons to include firearms.
(Covers 22CF1149, 22CF1150)

3:23 PM cases 22CF1149 and 22CF1150 called. Defendant Charles D. Marshall appeared by video, in custody without counsel.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Time limits have been waived for the preliminary hearing based on defendant's request for an attorney.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

(11:17 AM cases 22CF1149, 22CF1150 called.) Defendant Charles D. Marshall appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Charles D. Marshall. Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaints.
Attorney Anderson advises the defendant has provided her with a written statement he'd like her to read to the Court.
Defendant advises would like to represent himself and requests Attorney Anderson no longer speak. Attorney Anderson and Court advise defendant may represent himself.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
State requests $25,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Defendant requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $25,000.00 cash bond with conditions to cover both cases.
Defendant advises wants an attorney for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with co-defendants K.B., S.G.; J.B. or J.B.'s residence, M.W. or M.W.'s residence.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
No use or possession of weapons to include firearms.
